intro: Steganthera royenii, commonly known as the rock fig, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible fig-like fruits that are typically consumed by birds and small mammals. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
